image.altText: Caroline Page stands in the kitchen her two sons sitting at a bench

props.synopsis: Australia's child support system is outdated and not keeping pace with inflation, according to critics, who say it disproportionately disadvantages women.

title.children: 'Child support is an archaic system': Debts continue to rise as critics call for overhaul

image.altText: The word Cranbrook in gold on a sandstone column at the gates of a school.

props.synopsis: As both the federal government and Cranbrook announce investigations into the prestigious boys' school, Four Corners has been inundated with new concerning allegations.

title.children: Four Corners' Cranbrook investigation saw its headmaster resign. Now new allegations are flooding in

image.altText: A rice field in Bali

props.synopsis: Two foreign tourists including an Australian woman have been killed on the Indonesian resort island of Bali after heavy rain triggered a landslide that swept away their villa, an official said on Thursday.

title.children: Australian woman killed in Bali landslide

image.altText: nicotine pouches in tin

props.synopsis: School leaders are calling for proactive action to prevent students from purchasing nicotine pouches, with researchers warning the potency of products varies wildly and health risks remain unknown.

title.children: Teachers warn school kids may swap vapes for 'impossible-to detect' nicotine pouches

image.altText: A graphic showing a positive COVID-19 RAT, a representation of the virus and a woman blowing her nose.

props.synopsis: The state's chief health officer says the description wrongly implied long-term post-COVID viral symptoms were "somehow unique and exceptional" to other viral infections.

title.children: Queensland's Chief Health Officer says it's time to stop using the term 'long COVID'

props.synopsis: The Coalition says Labor's proposed fuel efficiency standards constitute a tax on utes and family cars. What do the experts say?

title.children: We fact checked Peter Dutton on whether Labor's new fuel efficiency standards are a 'ute tax'. Here's what we found

image.altText: Andrew Giles during QT

props.synopsis: Muslim community organisations are unhappy after grants announced for Muslim and Jewish communities to improve social cohesion were given to two news organisations and the Human Rights Commission instead of Islamic and Arab groups.

title.children: Muslim and Arab leaders incensed over distribution of social cohesion grants five months into war

image.altText: A herd of elephants gather in a grassy area.

props.synopsis: Prasong Promchart lost her sister-in-law in a deadly encounter with a wandering elephant. She is one of a growing number of Thais losing loved ones as the country grapples with increasing human-elephant conflict.

title.children: Elephants are Thailand's national animal but the wandering giants have become a deadly problem

image.altText: burnt-out truck on the side of a highway.

props.synopsis: The M1 Pacific Motorway is closed, with traffic diverted through Maclean in northern New South Wales, as emergency services attend the scene of a truck crash.

title.children: Truck driver walks away from fiery crash on M1 Motorway

image.altText: Graphic of Michele Bullock in front of a building and a for sale sign

props.synopsis: Leading US economist John H Cochrane says the evidence that higher interest rates lower inflation "is a lot shakier than you would think", and central banks can't manage the economy by themselves.

title.children: If you think central bankers know exactly what they're doing when they raise interest rates, a US economist has news for you

image.altText: A young man sitting on a park bench

props.synopsis: A coalition of almost 100 homelessness services is launching a new campaign demanding the federal government address the growing crisis.

title.children: Teenaged Raymond grew used to waking on a park bench. His story is now more common than ever

image.altText: A woman in front of a wall of flowers

props.synopsis: The father of slain Point Cook woman Chaithanya Madhagani says his son-in-law confessed to killing her, but does not know where he is now.

title.children: 'He admitted and confessed': Father of Chaithanya Madhagani says her husband apologised, gave away son, then disappeared

image.altText: Two nuclear power buildings in the night.

props.synopsis: If history had taken a different turn, Australia might now not be debating nuclear power but have had it up and running for decades, writes Michelle Grattan.

title.children: Like Peter Dutton, John Gorton once had a nuclear plan. It didn't end well

image.altText: Hani sitting listening to headphoens on the plane.

props.synopsis: Finally escaping the horrors of the Gaza Strip and holding onto hope for some reprieve, Hani has found himself trapped in visa limbo.

title.children: Hani thought he'd escaped the horrors of Gaza. Then his Australian visa was suddenly cancelled

image.altText: Two men wearing industrial ear muffs, black protective glasses and caps in a small room with electrical equipment.

props.synopsis: Bitcoin mining was about to end both Andy and Russ's marriages until they met each other and set up a "farm". But now they face more hurdles, as a pre-coded dystopian event looms and crypto-cynics predict a crash.

title.children: Bitcoin bros Russ and Andy are outback Australian miners of a new age variety

image.altText: A dirty package with letters R-Z on it

props.synopsis: More than 250 kilograms of cocaine has now washed ashore on New South Wales beaches and across the border into Victoria, with police appealing for information about the packages.

title.children: Another cocaine brick washes ashore in NSW as police recover 256 kilograms since December

image.altText: Little Pebble arrest

props.synopsis: Sandra Mathison and her partner William "Little Pebble" Kamm were arrested earlier this week and police have accused the pair of grooming a girl for years from the age of six.

title.children: Court hears 'very chilling' allegations about 'almost lifelong' grooming of child

image.altText: President Donald Trump participates in a video teleconference call with members of the military

props.synopsis: A bill before US Congress which would force TikTok to either sell up or face a ban has breezed through its first two tests — but don't expect an actual ban any time soon.

title.children: How Trump's disgust for 'enemy of the people' Facebook could save TikTok

image.altText: Traders work on the floor of the New York Stock Exchange (NYSE) shortly after the opening bell in New York, U.S.

props.synopsis: A much hotter-than-expected Producer Price Index in the US indicates inflation may be more stubborn than hoped, and rate cuts later and smaller than previously expected, sending stocks lower. Follow the day's events and insights from our business reporters on the ABC News live markets blog.

title.children: Surprise producer inflation numbers send US stocks sliding; futures point to ASX drop

liveBlogKeyEvents.title: Australian is not bitcoin inventor Satoshi Nakamoto, British court rules
Yen strengthens as wages deal to be announced, negative interest rates may end
US markets take a hit on producer prices, ASX to follow

image.altText: This image released by Universal Pictures shows Cillian Murphy in a scene from Oppenheimer.

props.synopsis: Japanese viewers appear split ahead of the delayed domestic release of Christopher Nolan's biopic of the father of the atomic bomb.

title.children: Why the global blockbuster Oppenheimer has been screened everywhere except Japan

image.altText: A woman wearing sunglasses

props.synopsis: A jury finds Chinese national Jie Shao guilty of manslaughter after she illegally performed breast surgery on clinic owner Jean Huang in 2017 in inner-city Sydney.

title.children: Woman found guilty of manslaughter after fatal breast procedure in Sydney clinic

image.altText: A man in a blue suit holds an envelope in his left hand.

props.synopsis: It's time to test your knowledge about the news of the week.

title.children: Weekly news quiz: From Oscars to who 'killed' Princess Catherine's photo, were you paying attention this week?

image.altText: Hitchhiking in Canada

props.synopsis: Alice Garner hitchhiked long distances with her dad when she was young, but she says she wouldn't let her daughter do it today. Why did it become viewed as a dangerous pursuit rather than an adventurous one?

title.children: Hitchhikers were once a common sight on the side of Australian roads. So what's changed?

image.altText: a sign to the entrance of the Ballarat Gold Mine

props.synopsis: A former engineer at Ballarat Gold Mine said they tried to have the mine shut down due to safety concerns, but Victorian regulations were not strong enough. They have joined miners and an alliance of environmental groups by calling for better state regulations.

title.children: Victorian miners call for stronger regulations after 'predictable' rockfall fatality

image.altText: Two images next to each other of a turtle head close-up with a white iris looking right, and an echidna close-up looking left

props.synopsis: Echidnas are known for laying eggs and eating ants, but it turns out a few have developed a hunger for the eggs of endangered turtles.

title.children: Mystery turtle nest raider revealed. Echidna caught with egg on its face

image.altText: Three Nigerian women wearing head scarves waiting for news about kidnapped children.

props.synopsis: People with extensive knowledge of the security crisis in Nigeria's north-west say the abductors of the school children are known and are hiding in the vast ungoverned and unoccupied forests of the region.

title.children: Nigerian government won't pay ransoms to release 300 kidnapped children

image.altText: A younger person's hand trailing along a cyclone-mesh fence.

props.synopsis: A report into child deaths across Queensland has revealed the shocking amount of time two young boys spent in solitary confinement in youth detention centres before their "preventable" deaths.

title.children: Two boys spent a combined 600 days in solitary confinement in youth detention before their 'preventable' deaths

image.altText: a map of cyclone

props.synopsis: Emergency services say Queensland residents are tired of a "relentless" wet season as the Bureau of Meteorology reports a tropical low is increasingly likely to become a cyclone on Sunday.

title.children: Queensland's 'relentless' wet season to continue amid growing threat of fourth cyclone

image.altText: A man stands outside a white bus surrounded by two security guards

props.synopsis: After four nights stranded by floodwaters in WA's outback Goldfields, the seven travellers have touched down in Kalgoorlie-Boulder.

title.children: Stranded travellers successfully rescued after four nights stranded in outback floods

image.altText: An oil painting of actor Judi Dench.

props.synopsis: In a career spanning three decades, Sydney-born artist Ralph Heimans has captured the world's most famous people on canvas — including royals, Academy Award-winners and some of Australia's most influential figures.

title.children: Some of the world's most recognisable faces on display at the National Portrait Gallery in Canberra

image.altText: Cameron Murray looks dejected during South Sydney's loss to Brisbane Broncos in round two of the 2024 NRL season.

props.synopsis: Winless after two matches, South Sydney is searching for answers, with coach Jason Demetriou unimpressed with his side's performance in the 28-18 defeat to Brisbane Broncos.

title.children: 'A horror show': Rabbitohs coach Demetriou gives scathing assessment after loss to Broncos

image.altText: A torn up demountable.

props.synopsis: Queensland Health's maternity patient records were left lying around in an unlocked dilapidated demountable office — dumped on public land on Thursday Island — the ABC has confirmed.

title.children: 'Incredibly serious' allegations referred to Crime and Corruption Commission as patient files found in dilapidated demountable

image.altText: A split image between a modern AFL player after a game, and an AFL player from 25 years ago looking across a ground.

props.synopsis: Clearance king Matt Rowell's astonishing game for the Suns drew headlines against Richmond, although it came up short of the great Paul Salmon — but as Cody Atkinson and Sean Lawson write, the truth of who holds the record may be a matter of definition and measurement.

title.children: Matt Rowell, Paul Salmon, and the footy record that was never to be

image.altText: Two rubber boats bob around in open ocean while a third boat helps people off one of them

props.synopsis: The SOS Mediterranee charity says the migrants departed from Zawiya, in Libya, before "their engine broke after three days, leaving their boat lost [and] adrift without water and food".

title.children: Women and children among 60 migrants feared to have drowned in Mediterranean Sea

image.altText: A group of Japanese men and women gather outside a court in Tokyo displaying messages of support for marriage equality.

props.synopsis: Business leaders are concerned the government's opposition to same-sex marriage could see talented people look to move elsewhere, after two courts rule the ban is unconstitutional.

title.children: A high court in Japan has ruled the country's ban on same-sex marriage is discriminatory
